entries: The gatorfolk makes a melee or ranged weapon attack. If the attack hits, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or it takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) weapon damage, has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The gatorfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Marshal Allies
entries: Unless the gatorfolk is {@condition incapacitated}, it and creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gatorfolk makes two melee attacks. one with its Bite and one with its Spiked Greatclub or Tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spiked Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rallying Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the gatorfolk's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Rallying Cry gains 9 ({@damage 2d8}) temporary hit points and advantage on saving throws until the start of the gatorfolk's next turn. The gatorfolk can then make one attack as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Tail Swipe
entries: When an enemy the gatorfolk can see moves within 10 feet of the gatorfolk, the gatorfolk can make one Tail attack against that enemy.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The gatorfolk moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The gatorfolk makes a Bite attack.

legendary.name: Intimidate Foe
entries: The gatorfolk targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the gatorfolk, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the gatorfolk until the end of the gatorfolk's next turn.

legendary.name: Club (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The gatorfolk makes a Spiked Greatclub attack.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The gatorfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gatorfolk makes two attacks, one of which must be a Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and if the target is a creature, it can't use reactions until the end of the giant's next turn.

action.name: Summon Wolves (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The giant summons {@dice 3d6} wolves, {@dice 2d4} dire wolves, or {@dice 1d2} winter wolves. The wolves appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the giant and acts as its allies. The wolves act right after the giant on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They remain for 1 hour, until they or the giant dies, or until the giant dismisses them as an action.

reaction.name: Protective Wolf
entries: When the giant is hit by an attack, one allied wolf within 5 feet of the giant must use its reaction to be hit by the attack instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

legendary.name: Move
entries: The giant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Command Wolf
entries: The giant targets one allied wolf it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the giant, the target can use its reaction to make one melee weapon attack or move up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant makes a melee or ranged attack.

legendary.name: Piercing Frost Arrow (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The giant shoots a magical arrow of ethereal cold that streaks in a line that is 120 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it also suffers 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant uses Maneuver Allies, if available. It then makes two Battleaxe attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +11 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of the giant that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

action.name: War Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the giant's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by War Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the giant's next turn. All other creatures within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by War Cry must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the giant's next turn. The giant can then make one attack as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Battle Command
entries: The giant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the giant, the target can use its reaction to make one melee attack or to take the {@action Dodge} or {@action Hide} action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The giant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Kick Ice
entries: The giant kicks ice and snow in a 15-foot cone. Each Medium or smaller creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. The giant must be standing on icy or snowy ground to use this action.

legendary.name: Cunning Instruction
entries: The giant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the giant, the target gains advantage on its next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw until the start of the giant's next turn.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant makes a melee or ranged attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant uses Kostchtchie's Curse. It then makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Kostchtchie's Curse
entries: The giant targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is cursed and gains vulnerability to cold that lasts for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the giant's Kostchtchie's Curse for the next 24 hours. Casting {@spell remove curse}, {@spell greater restoration}, or a similar spell on the target ends the effect.

action.name: Glacial Rift {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant opens a momentary extraplanar rift to the Iron Wastes. The rift is a blizzard-filled, 20-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 31 ({@damage 7d8}) cold damage and can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Breath of Auril {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales magical frost in a 20-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage and is encased in ice for 1 minute. While encased, a creature is {@condition restrained}. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, breaking the ice on a success. The ice can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12; hp 25; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't encased in ice.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):
footerEntries: {@i *The giant casts this spell on itself before combat.}

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Il revenant recupera 10 punti ferita all'inizio del suo turno. Se il vendicatore subisce danni da fuoco o radianti, questo tratto non funziona all'inizio del suo turno successivo. Il corpo del vendicatore viene distrutto solo se inizia il suo turno con 0 punti ferita e non si rigenera.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another frost giant corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Il revenant è immune agli effetti che trasformano i non morti.

trait.name: Vengeful Strikes
entries: Se il bersaglio colpito dall'attacco in mischia del vendicatore è una creatura contro cui il vendicatore ha giurato vendetta, il bersaglio subisce 14 ({@damage 4d6}) danni da arma extra.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: Il vendicatore conosce la distanza e la direzione di qualsiasi creatura contro cui cerca di vendicarsi, anche se la creatura e il vendicatore si trovano su piani di esistenza diversi. Se la creatura inseguita dal vendicatore muore, il vendicatore lo sa.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two Greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
entries: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is {@condition frightened} of the revenant for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Maul attacks. It can replace one of its attacks with Ground Pound, if it is available.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +11 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ground Pound {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant slams its maul on the ground, triggering an earth tremor and violently pelting the area with debris. Each creature on the ground originating from the giant in a 15-foot cube must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Mammoth Rider
entries: The giant has advantage on melee attacks its makes while riding a mammoth.

trait.name: Mounted Charge
entries: If the giant, while mounted, moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 2d12}) weapon damage and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is prone, the giant's mammoth mount can use its reaction to make one stomp attack against it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks. It can use Mammoth Stomp in place of one of these attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., or range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Mammoth Stomp
entries: The giant's mammoth mount uses its reaction to make one Stomp attack. The giant must be mounted on its mammoth (Basic Rules, pg. 143) to use this action.

action.name: Mammoth Trample {@recharge 5}
entries: While mounted on a mammoth, the giant moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the giant enters must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed 5 feet to the nearest space out of the giant's path. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone} and takes 29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the giant remains in the prone creature's space, the creature is also {@condition restrained} until it's no longer in the same space as the giant. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a {@dc 18} Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the giant and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Spear attacks, or one Spear attack and casts one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Imix's Embrace {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant targets up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must be within 30 feet of each other. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage and suffers 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Battle Concentration
entries: The giant has advantage on Constitution saving throws that it makes to maintain concentration on a spell when it takes damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Longsword attacks. Alternatively, it can make one Longsword attack and cast one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +10 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Opportunity Spell
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an {@action opportunity attack} from the giant, it can use its reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an {@action opportunity attack}. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):
footerEntries: {@i *The giant casts this spell on itself before combat.}

trait.name: Overpowering Charge
entries: If the giant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. If the target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Rooted
entries: The giant has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would pull, push, or knock it prone.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The giant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 6d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +14 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crushing Stride
entries: The giant moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the giant enters must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed 5 feet to the nearest space out of the giant's path. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone} and takes 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the giant remains in the prone creature's space, the creature is also {@condition restrained} until it's no longer in the same space as the giant. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a {@dc 22} Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the giant and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two melee attacks: one with its Chain and one with its Hook. It can replace its Chain attack with Chain Sweep, Chain Lash, or Chain Smash, if available.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and if the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pulled 15 feet toward the giant.

action.name: Hook
entries: {@atk mw} +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and if the target is Huge or smaller creature, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the giant can automatically hit the target with its hook, and the giant can't attack another target with its hook.

action.name: Chain Sweep
entries: The giant swings its chain, and every creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Chain Lash
entries: The giant whips and slams its chain on the ground in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Chain Smash {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 6d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8 ) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The {@condition unconscious} target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +12 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Aura of Conquest
entries: If the giant isn't {@condition incapacitated}, a creature frightened of the giant that starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and has its speed is reduced to 0.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} +12 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Conquering Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The giant forces each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of the giant for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):

legendary.name: Move
entries: The giant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Oppressing Word
entries: The giant casts {@spell command} or {@spell hold person}.

legendary.name: Burning Glare of Surtur
entries: The giant turns its gaze toward one creature it can see within 60 feet of it and commands it to combust. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition frightened}.

legendary.name: Longsword (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant makes a Longsword attack.

trait.name: Arcane Firearm
entries: When the giant casts a spell, roll a {@dice d8}, and the giant gains a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to the number rolled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Handaxe attacks.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Arcane Turret (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The giant magically summons a Large turret in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of it. The turret is a magical object that occupies its space and that has crablike legs. It has an AC of 18 and 120 hit points. It is immune to poison damage, psychic damage, and all conditions. If it is forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, treat all its ability scores as 10 ({@damage +0}). If the mending spell is cast on it, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 10 minutes. The giant can dismiss it early as an action.
When the giant summons the turret, it decides which type it is, choosing from the options listed below:

items.name: 1. Flamethrower.
items.entry: The turret exhales fire in an adjacent 30-foot cone that you designate. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

items.name: 2. Force Ballista.
items.entry: Make a, originating from the turret, at one creature or object within 120 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage and if the target is a creature, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from the turret.

items.name: 3. Defender.
items.entry: The turret emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice within 20 feet of it {@dice 2d8 + 3} temporary hit points.

entries: On each of its turns, the giant can take a bonus action to cause the turret to activate if it is within 60 feet of it. As part of the same action, the giant can direct the turret to walk or climb up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space.

The giant can use an action to command the turret to detonate if is within 60 feet of it. Doing so destroys the turret and forces each creature within 20 feet of it to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

monster.name: Favored Young Dragon of Tiamat

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Multi-headed
entries: The dragon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}. For each head the dragon has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +11 a colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) danni da taglio.

legendaryHeader: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

The dragon's legendary action options are associated with its three dragon heads (a bite and a breath weapon for each). Once the dragon chooses a legendary action option for one of its heads, it can't choose another one associated with that head until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon {@action Attack}: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage (blue dragon head), fire damage (red dragon head), or cold damage (white dragon head).

legendary.name: Blue Dragon Head
entries: Lightning Breath (Costs 2 Actions). The dragon exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this breath weapon is used, the dragon can't use it again until all other breath weapon have been used.

legendary.name: Red Dragon Head
entries: Fire Breath (Costs 2 Actions). The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this breath weapon is used, the dragon can't use it again until all other breath weapon have been used.

legendary.name: White Dragon Head
entries: Cold Breath (Costs 2 Actions). The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this breath weapon is used, the dragon can't use it again until all other breath weapon have been used.

monster.name: Favored Adult Dragon of Tiamat

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Multi-headed
entries: The dragon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}. For each head the dragon has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks. two with its Claw and one with its Tail.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendaryHeader: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

The dragon's legendary action options are associated with its three dragon heads (a bite and a breath weapon for each). Once the dragon chooses a legendary action option for one of its heads, it can't choose another one associated with that head until the start of it's next turn.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon {@action Attack}: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage (blue dragon head), fire damage (red dragon head), or cold damage (white dragon head).

legendary.name: Blue Dragon Head
entries: Lightning Breath (Costs 2 Actions). The dragon exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 9d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this breath weapon is used, the dragon can't use it again until all other breath weapon have been used.

legendary.name: Red Dragon Head
entries: Fire Breath (Costs 2 Actions). The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this breath weapon is used, the dragon can't use it again until all other breath weapon have been used.

legendary.name: White Dragon Head
entries: Cold Breath (Costs 2 Actions). The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this breath weapon is used, the dragon can't use it again until all other breath weapon have been used.

monster.name: Eyewing
languages: understands Abyssal and Infernal but can't speak

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The eyewing doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature other than an eyewing that starts its turn within 5 feet of the eyewing must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all eyewings for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eyewing makes two attacks: one with its Claws and one with its Stinger.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tear Splash {@recharge 5}
entries: The eyewing drops a one-foot-diameter ball of poisonous liquid at a point on the ground directly below it. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. Until this poison ends, a creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

monster.name: Eye of Gulguthra

trait.name: Putrefying Cone
entries: The eye of gulguthra's central eye creates an area of rot and debilitating sickness, in a 150-foot cone. While inside the area of effect, a creature has disadvantage to Strength and Constitution saving throws. If a creature ends its turn within the area of effect, it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage. At the start of each of its turns, the eye of gulguthra decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eye of gulguthra makes three attacks. one with its Bite and two with its Tentacle.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@damage 1d10}) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The eye of gulguthra has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: The eye of gulguthra slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the eye of gulguthra's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The eye of gulguthra shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to two targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Paralyzing Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 2. Fear Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 3. Enervation Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 4. Exhaustion Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

items.name: 5. Weakening Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

items.name: 6. Slowing Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 7. Mindrotting Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or the target's Intelligence score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target's Intelligence score cannot go below 1. If the target's Intelligence score is 1, the target can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The target can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

items.name: 8. Death Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendaryHeader: The eye of gulguthra can take 3 legendary actions, using the Eye Ray option below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The eye of gulguthra regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The eye of gulguthra uses one random eye ray.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: The eye of gulguthra attacks with its tentacle.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The equinal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak With Beasts
entries: The equinal can communicate with beasts as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, the equinal's AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The equinal uses Whinny, if available. It then makes three unarmed attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the equinal can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (equinal's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the equinal's next turn.

action.name: Whinny (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The equinal emits a piercing shriek. Each nonguardinal creature within 20 feet of the equinal must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The equinal casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it dies, the naga returns to life in {@dice 1d6} days and regains all its hit points. Only a {@spell wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
entries: When the naga makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The naga makes two melee attacks: one with its Bite and one to Constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit. 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the naga can't constrict another target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naga casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal components and Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):

monster.name: Eldritch Assassin
languages: Thieves' cant plus any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the eldritch assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the eldritch assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The eldritch assassin deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the eldritch assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the eldritch assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eldritch assassin makes two Shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Hexblade's Curse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The eldritch assassin targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, the eldritch assassin dies, or it is {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, the eldritch assassin gains the following benefits.

items: It deals an extra 3 damage on damage rolls against the cursed target.
Any attack roll it makes against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.
If the cursed target dies, the eldritch assassin regains 14 hit points.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: When hit by an attack roll by a creature cursed by the eldritch assassin's Hexblade's Curse, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 4 or higher, the attack instead misses the eldritch assassin, regardless of its roll.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The guard drake can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

monster.name: Druj Head
languages: the languages it knew in life but it can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Annihilation
entries: The druj can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the druj. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The druj has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the druj has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit. 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature zombie} under the druj's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The druj can have no more than twelve {@creature zombie|mm|zombies} under its control at one time.

action.name: Dreadful Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: The druj emits a bloodcurdling scream. Each creature that is neither a fiend nor an undead within 60 feet of the druj must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to druj's Dreadful Scream for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druj casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):

monster.name: Druj Claw
languages: the languages it knew in life but it can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Annihilation
entries: The druj can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the druj. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The druj has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The druj can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the druj has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning or slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage (druj's choice) and if the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the druj can automatically hit the target with its claw, and the druj can't attack another target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature zombie} under the druj's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The druj can have no more than twelve {@creature zombie|mm|zombies} under its control at one time.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druj casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the druid fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spell Penetration
entries: When the druid casts a spell and is interrupted by an enemy's {@spell counterspell}, treat the spell's level as 3 levels higher.

trait.name: Supreme Focus
entries: The druid has advantage on saving throws it makes to maintain its concentration.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit ({@hit 7} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):
footerEntries: *The druid casts these spells on itself before combat.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The druid moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The druid casts produce flame or shillelagh.

legendary.name: Quarterstaff
entries: The druid attacks with its Quarterstaff.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The druid casts {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell entangle}, {@spell erupting earth|XGE}, {@spell spike growth}, or {@spell thunderwave}, if available.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drider makes three Rapier attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a Bite attack. Alternatively, it can make one Rapier attack and cast one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the drider fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spider Climb

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drider makes three attacks. either with its Pike or its Longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a Bite attack or Web Cocoon, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. If the target is not immune to poison, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Web Cocoon {@recharge 5}
entries: The drider targets a creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition restrained} by very thick webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 16} Strength check with disadvantage on the roll, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 15; hp 50; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Summon Spider (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The drider summons {@dice 2d6} giant wolf spiders, {@dice 1d6} jumping spiders (see Appendix 1. Miscellaneous Creatures), or {@dice 1d3} giant spiders. The spiders appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the drider and acts as its allies. The spiders act right after the drider on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They remain for 1 hour, until they or the drider dies, or until the drider dismisses them as an action.

legendary.name: Crawl
entries: The drider moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Command Spider
entries: The drider targets one allied spider it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the drider, the target can use its reaction to make one weapon attack or move up to its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The drider makes a melee or ranged attack.

entries: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The drider's ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the drider's ranged weapon attack rolls.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Walker

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Stealthy
entries: Asa bonus action, the drider can take the {@action Hide} action.

bonus.name: Steady Aim (3/Day)
entries: The drider takes careful aim at a creature it can see within range of its ranged weapon. Until the end of its turn, the drider deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage with each of its ranged weapon attacks against the target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drider casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dragonroot tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonroot tree makes three Dragonroot Bite attacks. It can use Seed Pod in place of one attack, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the dragonroot tree can automatically hit the target with its Bite attack. The dragonroot tree has six dragonroot, each of which can bite one target.

Each dragonroot can be attacked (AC 16; 50 hit points; immunity to psychic damage). Destroying a dragonroot deals no damage to the dragonroot tree, which can regrow a replacement dragonroot in 24 hours.

action.name: Seed Pod {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragonroot tree lobs one of its seed pods at a point within 30 feet of it. The seed pod explodes and releases toxic spores. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, a creature is {@condition incapacitated} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Plants and creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the dracotaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its Pike on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Battle Concentration
entries: The dracotaur has advantage on Constitution saving throws that it makes to maintain concentration on a spell when it takes damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dracotaur makes three melee attacks: one with its Pike, one with its Bite, and one with its Tail. Alternatively, it can make one Pike attack and cast one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spit Fire {@recharge 6}
entries: The dracotaur spits fire at a point within 30 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Opportunity Spell
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an {@action opportunity attac} from the dracotaur, it can use its reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an {@action opportunity attack}.
The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

reaction.name: Boon of Tiamat (3/Day)
entries: The dracotaur grants a + {@hit 5} bonus to an attack roll made by an allied creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The dracotaur can make this choice after the roll is made but before it hits or misses. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) energy damage of the type chosen by the dracotaur (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dracotaur casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit withspell attacks):

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the dracotaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its Greataxe on the same turn, the target takes an extra 6 ({@damage 1d12}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Marshal Allies
entries: Unless the dracotaur is {@condition incapacitated}, it and creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dracotaur makes three melee attacks: one with its Greataxe or Javelin, one with its Bite, and one with its Tail.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite

action.name: War Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the dracotaur's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by War Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the dracotaur's next turn. All other creatures within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by War Cry must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the dracotaur's next turn. The dracotaur can then make one attack as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Directed Strike (3/Day)
entries: When a creature the dracotaur can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll, and the creature can hear the dracotaur, the dracotaur grants advantage to that roll.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The dracotaur moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The dracotaur makes a melee or ranged attack.

legendary.name: Tactical Command
entries: The dracotaur targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the dracotaur, the target can use its reaction to make one melee attack, move up to its speed, or move up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the dracotaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its Greataxe on the same turn, the target takes an extra 6 ({@damage 1d12}) slashing damage.
